page.title:
The Software Revolution
The Software Revolution
page.normal_text:
FOURTH WORKSHOP ON DISTRIBUTED SUPERCOMPUTERS
FOURTH WORKSHOP ON DISTRIBUTED SUPERCOMPUTERS

March 9-10, 2000 Parc St. Charles Hotel New Orleans, LA, USA
March 9-10, 2000
Parc St. Charles Hotel
New Orleans, LA, USA

John Reynders Advanced Computing Laboratory Los Alamos
John Reynders
Advanced Computing Laboratory
Los Alamos

page.title:
Thesis:
Thesis:
page.normal_text:
One of the principal challenges facing the future of HPC software development is the encapsulation of architectural complexity
One of the principal
challenges facing the future
of HPC software development
is the encapsulation of
architectural complexity

page.title:
Sustaining software encapsulation challenges of the future
Sustaining software encapsulation
challenges of the future
page.enlisting:
 Software to punch through the Memory wall + Until processing starts to move out into the memory, the memory wall + Must program for deep memory hierarchies » cache-based threading, nano-tasking, blocking, memory affinity,  Encapsulate System Factorization + Separate “curves” for nodes, interconnect, and I/O follow best-of  Heterogeneous computing + Linux nodes age like fruit flies + software must manage differing CPU speeds, memory sizes,  Fault tolerant software systems + interconnect, nodes, I/O + Like Blue Gene - must have self-correction to scale  Software to punch through the Memory wall
 Software to punch through the Memory wall  S o f t w a r e

page.title:
Disruptive software encapsulation challenges of the future ( other market drivers besides clustering )
Disruptive software encapsulation challenges of
the future
( other market drivers besides clustering )
page.enlisting:
 Data-centric computing ( OLTP, Warehouses ) + Getting too expensive to save, move, visualize data + Bringing services too the data » e.g. viz engines, direct attached storage devices + Software must become more data-aware » higher-level schema for data partitioning, movement, and affinity  Reconfigurable computing ( signal processing, cryptoanalysis ) + Xilinx and Altera have multi-million transistor FPGAs which fit into + can burn in multiple FP ALUs  Data-centric computing ( OLTP, Warehouses )

page.enlisting:
 Software integration of smarter components ( general trend of making each component in a system more capable ) + how many computing devices are in your car? + Soon: Smart NICS, Smart switches, Smart disks » message processing on the NIC » network-aware gather/scatter » disk-based stride/sub-block processing + Later: Smart memory » balance of CPU and memory across architecture » breaking memory-access/FPU components of algorithms up  Software integration of smarter components ( general trend of

page.title:
Software Futures
Software Futures
page.enlisting:
 Compiler design/Run-time design + Computing across heterogeneous resources » disks, NICS,CPU, memory + Deeper and deeper memory hierarchy + High-level language to FPGA/VHDL + Explicit Data management ( remember NEWS and HPF:::Layout ) + threading everywhere - even in the CPU level + enable gray area between compile and run times » e.g., run-time compilation, telescoping compilers ( Kennedy )  Language trends + Fortran into C++ - happening now + C++ into Java- happening soon ( attacking from the bottom ) + Java into ??? ( more explicit language based concurrency? )  Final thought:  Compiler design/Run-time design
 Compiler design/Run-time design  C o m p i l e r
d e s i g n / R u n - t i m e

page.title:
Software Futures
Software Futures
page.enlisting:
 Compiler design/Run-time design + Computing across heterogeneous resources » disks, NICS,CPU, memory + Deeper and deeper memory hierarchy + High-level language to FPGA/VHDL + Explicit data management ( remember NEWS and HPF::Layout ) + threading everywhere - even in the CPU + enable gray area between compile and run times » e.g., run-time compilation, telescoping compilers ( Kennedy )  Language trends + Fortran into C++ - happening now + C++ into Java- happening soon ( attacking from the bottom ) + Java into ??? ( commodity directions? explicit language concurrency? )  Final thought: + Reynders 3 years from now: a C++ dinosaur… ;)  Compiler design/Run-time design

page.title:
Vision Summary:
Vision Summary:
page.normal_text:
The Software Revolution must move the complexity of the evolving cluster architecture into compilers, run-time systems, encapsulating components, and perhaps languages to manage the revolution of architectural complexity that is coming down the road.
The Software Revolution must
move the complexity of the
evolving cluster architecture
into compilers, run-time
systems, encapsulating
components, and perhaps
languages to manage the
revolution of architectural
complexity that is coming
down the road.
